Ferroelectric two-dimensional (2D) materials are of great importance in realizing non-volatile devices with extreme feature size
1, 2 , and possibly with unforeseen functionalities from the unique properties of 2D materials
3, 4 . However, studies on the 2D ferroelectrics are yet an emerging field. Only a few materials such as SnTe
5 , α-In 2Se 3
6 have been experimentally shown to work in agreement with theories
7– 9 . Transition metal dichalcogenide (TMDC) is another major 2D materials class showing versatile electronic phases ranging from semiconducting or metallic phase to that with topological characteristics
10– 12 . Nonetheless, the ferroelectricity of the TMDC is very scarce due to the underlying symmetry of single layer in stable phase, which is either non-polar or centrosymmetric, precluding the electric polarization; i.e. 2H (
